desc.p: OFS.SOURCE to be used in the corporate actions process when
it goes through EB.PHANTOM.
Must be a valid OFS.SOURCE record
SOURCE.TYPE of the OFS.SOURCE record must be "BATCH"
Must be a valid record from the STANDARD.SELECTION application.
This field will be used to create or reverse Entitlements using the user of DIARY record.
Indicate if the overrides encountred in the corporate action process
should be automatically validated by the system or not.
"NO" will cause record written in HOLD when overrides occurs
Only "YES" or "NO" allowed
OFS.SOURCE record that will be used in the corporate actions process.
It will be invoked for on-line processing.
OFS.SOURCE for background process will be indicated in the
OFS.SRC.PHANTOM field, used by EB.PHANTOM.
Must be a valid OFS.SOURCE record
SOURCE.TYPE of the OFS.SOURCE must be "GLOBUS"
Version to be used in the corporate actions process.
It will overwite the version name indicated in the OFS.SOURCE record.
Must be a valid VERSION record
Currently only one SWIFT indicator can be mapped to a EVENT.TYPE.
If the user wishes to use the same indicator for multiple Events then it can be done locally by attaching the routine here.
Tolerance category should be in the range of 10000-19999.
If either tolerance percentage or currency or amount is input and if this field is left blank then error INPUT MISSING will be thrown.
Tolerance allowed for corporate action events is defined in terms of Percentage.
If this field is defined then input to the field tolerance currency and amount should not be allowed and vice versa.
Fields Tolerance.Ccy and Tolerance.Amt are associative multi value set.
If the field is blank and tolerance amount is specified then it will be defaulted with local currency.
Must be a valid CURRENCY record
Amount of Tolerance for corporate action events allowed is defined here.
Accepts value YES.
The message 564 will either commit or authorise SC.PRE.DIARY based on the process code and the log will be updated.
